poem:
**Raccoons in Kassel**

In Kassel, raccoons plot beneath the moon,  
like masked bandits on a European spree.  
From rooftops to picnics, they boldly commune,  
their mischief spinning tales for all to see.  

An urban fable where paws tiptoe,  
whispering to the city's sleepy mind—  
raccoons, across Europe, dance the limelight show,  
leaving only folklore behind.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rampaging raccoons: how the American mammals took over a German city – and are heading across Europe In Kassel, everyone has a story about raccoons. Some struggle with a family of them that moved into their roof and simply will not leave. Others recount how a picnic in the park turned into an ambush as gangs of the black and white animals, known in Germany as Waschbären, raided the food. Almost everyone seems to have". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
